remarks: The expression ` x = y ` in antecedent position plays an important role in predicate logic, namely in implicit substitution.  However, occasionally it is irrelevant, and can safely be dropped.  A sufficient condition for this is when ` x ` (or ` y ` or both) is not free in ` ph ` . This theorem is more fundamental than ~ equsal , ~ spimt or ~ sbft , to which it is related.  (Contributed by Wolf Lammen, 19-Aug-2018.)
statement: wl-equsal1t $p |- ( F/ x ph -> ( A. x ( x = y -> ph ) <-> ph ) ) $.
